intro: Lyonia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered lyonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Lyonia fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
